Class DateTimeUtils

java.lang.Object
com.github.pankaj111.coreutils.date.DateTimeUtils
public final class DateTimeUtils extends Object
Utility class for common date and time operations and conversions. Handles conversions between LocalDate, LocalDateTime, and legacy Date. All methods are null-safe and return null if any input parameter is null.

This class is thread-safe and uses caching for better performance with frequently used patterns.

Version:
1.1
Author:
Pankaj Jain

    • setDefaultZoneId

      public static void setDefaultZoneId(ZoneId zoneId)
      Sets the default timezone to be used by methods that don't explicitly accept a ZoneId.
      Parameters:
      zoneId - the timezone to set as default (cannot be null)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if zoneId is null

      Returns:

      IllegalArgumentException - if the pattern is invalid

    • parseToDate

      public static Date parseToDate(String dateStr, String pattern)
      Parses a string representation of a date into a java.util.Date object using the default timezone.
      Parameters:
      dateStr - the string to parse
      pattern - the pattern to use for parsing
      Returns:
      the parsed Date, or null if either input is null
      Throws:
      DateTimeParseException - if the text cannot be parsed
      IllegalArgumentException - if the pattern is invalid

    • parseToDate

      public static Date parseToDate(String dateStr, String pattern, ZoneId zoneId)
      Parses a string representation of a date into a java.util.Date object using the specified timezone.
      Parameters:
      dateStr - the string to parse
      pattern - the pattern to use for parsing
      zoneId - the timezone to use for conversion
      Returns:
      the parsed Date, or null if any input is null
      Throws:
      DateTimeParseException - if the text cannot be parsed
      IllegalArgumentException - if the pattern is invalid

    • removeTime

      public static Date removeTime(Date date)
      Removes the time component from a java.util.Date, returning a new Date representing only the date part (at 00:00:00 in the default timezone).
      Parameters:
      date - the Date from which to remove the time component
      Returns:
      a new Date with time set to 00:00:00, or null if input is null

    • removeTime

      public static Date removeTime(Date date, ZoneId zoneId)
      Removes the time component from a java.util.Date, returning a new Date representing only the date part (at 00:00:00 in the specified timezone).
      Parameters:
      date - the Date from which to remove the time component
      zoneId - the timezone to use for conversion
      Returns:
      a new Date with time set to 00:00:00, or null if any input is null

    • removeTime

      public static LocalDate removeTime(LocalDateTime dateTime)

      Parameters:
      dateTime - the LocalDateTime from which to remove the time component
      Returns:
      the LocalDate part, or null if input is null

    • addDays

      public static Date addDays(Date date, int days)
      Adds days to a java.util.Date using the default timezone.
      Parameters:
      date - the Date to add days to
      days - the number of days to add (can be negative to subtract)
      Returns:
      a new Date with the days added, or null if input is null
